    • Method Detail

      • getLineNumber

        public static int getLineNumber()
        Calls getLineNumber(3). It's doing three because the method which calls this method will be 3 away from the beginning of the stack trace
        Returns:
        See Also:
        getLineNumber(int numberBack)

      • getLineNumber

        public static int getLineNumber(int numberBack)
        Returns the line number on the stack trace the given number back on the trace. Normally, if you want the line number of the caller of this method you'll give 2 (or call the convenience method which defaults to 2). This kind of method is useful for debugging purposes mostly
        Parameters:
        numberBack - the number on the stack trace to get the line number from.
        Returns:
        the line number on the stack trace numberBack away from given trace (the method which calls this would be "2" numberBack

      • getDebugInfo

        public static java.lang.String getDebugInfo(int numberBack)
        Helpful for debugging. Give 2 for the line which is calling this method.
        Parameters:
        numberBack -
        Returns:
        className + "." + methodName + "():" + lineNumber of the specified number back on the stack trace.
        See Also:
        getDebugInfo()

      • getDebugInfo

        public static java.lang.String getDebugInfo()
